title: TechPowerUp Readers Willing to Move Away from Windows after Windows 10 EOL: Frontpage Poll
summary: ï¼ˆAIåˆ¶é™ä¸­ã®ãŸã‚åŸæ–‡ï¼‰ In Q4 2025, we asked our readers if in the light of Microsoft discontinuing Windows 10 and rising di...
content:
â€»APIåˆ¶é™ã®ãŸã‚åŸæ–‡ã‚’è¡¨ç¤ºã—ã¾ã™

In Q4 2025, we asked our readers if in the light of Microsoft discontinuing Windows 10 and rising dissatisfaction with Windows 11, they would consider moving away from Windows altogether to alternative operating systems. The results are fascinating. Over the quarter, our frontpage poll gathered over 34,000 responses. A significant majority of 55.4% (18,981 readers) voted that they would consider moving away from Windows to Linux. What's more interesting is that only 4.5% (1,538 readers) say that they're willing to move to macOS (replace their PC with a Mac of some shape or form). A marginal 1.9% say they are willing give up the PC as their main client computing device, and switch to a game console, such as the latest Xbox Series S/X or PlayStation 5; and probably stick to endpoints handed out by their work/school. These three responses add up to 61.8% or nearly two-thirds of our readers being disillusioned with Windows. 38.2%, or 13,105 readers answered that they will not consider moving away from Windows. The poll suggests a general sense of dissatisfaction with being restricted to Windows 11. Comments suggest that this stems from its interface being seen by some as a downgrade from Windows 10, besides its latest slew of other Microsoft products, such as 365, Copilot, Teams, and Bing, being seen as invasive or bloatware.

review_en: Seriously impressive specs! Bringing edge AI to construction sites is a game-changer, and the processing power achieved through the NVIDIA partnership feels like the future. Huge potential for improved safety and reduced operator fatigue!
title_en: Caterpillar Revolutionizes Construction Sites with Edge AI! Powerful Partnership with NVIDIA!
summary_en:
â€¢ Caterpillar announced its edge AI solutions powered by NVIDIA Jetson Thor at CES.
â€¢ The integration of AI into construction machinery is expected to significantly improve site safety, efficiency, and automation.
â€¢ The use of speech models will enable natural interaction with machines, reducing operator workload.
content_en:
Caterpillar announced a strategic partnership with NVIDIA and unveiled edge AI solutions at CES 2026. At the core of this solution is NVIDIA's latest platform, Jetson Thor, which is expected to dramatically improve data processing capabilities on construction sites. Specifically, the system analyzes real-time data from sensors embedded in construction machinery to provide hazard predictions for operators, detect machine anomalies, and optimize work efficiency. Furthermore, leveraging NVIDIA's speech models, operators can use voice commands and queries, creating a more intuitive and safe operating environment. This technology is poised to accelerate digital transformation within the construction industry and significantly contribute to increased productivity.

Review (EN)

Seriously impressive specs! Bringing edge AI to construction sites is a game-changer, and the processing power achieved through the NVIDIA partnership feels like the future. Huge potential for improved safety and reduced operator fatigue!

title_en: GeForce NOW Revolutionized: Linux Support & Fire TV App Unleash New Gaming Possibilities!
summary_en:
â€¢ GeForce NOW introduces native Linux support, expanding accessibility to cloud gaming.
â€¢ A dedicated app for Amazon Fire TV is now available, bringing GeForce NOW to the big screen.
â€¢ HOTAS controller support has been added for flight simulators, enhancing immersion.
content_en:
NVIDIA's GeForce NOW has unveiled a series of announcements at CES 2026, significantly enhancing the gaming experience with native Linux support, the release of an Amazon Fire TV app, and the addition of HOTAS controller support for flight simulators. The Linux support expands service availability to a previously inaccessible user base. The Fire TV app provides a new way to enjoy high-quality cloud gaming on the big screen in the living room. Furthermore, HOTAS controller support delivers a more realistic and immersive experience in games like flight simulators. These updates collectively elevate GeForce NOW's appeal as a leading cloud gaming platform.

Linux support is a game-changer! Huge news for those previously locked out of GeForce NOW. Fire TV app + HOTAS? NVIDIA is speaking my language! ğŸ”¥

review_en: This is insane! NVIDIA tech in a care robot? The future of elder care is looking seriously bright. Lunar landing tech for robots?! Mind. Blown.
title_en: Breaking News! JST Develops NVIDIA-Powered Moonshot Robot for Elderly Care â€“ Revolutionizing Care by 2050!
summary_en:
â€¢ The Japan Science and Technology Agency (JST) is developing 'Moonshot,' an autonomous learning care robot powered by NVIDIA's AI technology.
â€¢ The project aims to popularize AI robots in elderly care by 2050, utilizing an innovative approach inspired by lunar landing technology.
â€¢ This robot has the potential to surpass the limitations of conventional care robots and autonomously perform more complex tasks.
content_en:
The Japan Science and Technology Agency (JST) is developing a groundbreaking care robot through the 'Moonshot' research program, accelerated by NVIDIA's AI and robotics technologies. This robot aims to support elderly care by autonomously learning and utilizing AI by 2050. The Moonshot program leverages lunar landing technology to achieve the realization of robots capable of autonomously performing complex tasks that were previously difficult for conventional care robots. This project, combining NVIDIA's powerful AI processing capabilities with JST's years of research and development, has the potential to significantly contribute to solving the caregiving challenges in Japan's aging society. Future developments will be closely watched.

Review (EN)

This is insane! NVIDIA tech in a care robot? The future of elder care is looking seriously bright. Lunar landing tech for robots?! Mind. Blown.

review_en: Wow! AI controlling a particle accelerator? This feels straight out of science fiction. Expecting a huge boost in research speed. A great example for Japanese research institutions to embrace AI!
title_en: AI Takes the Helm at Berkeley's X-Ray Accelerator: A Potential Revolution in Scientific Research!
summary_en:
â€¢ An AI agent, 'Accelerator Assistant,' is supporting X-ray research at the Advanced Light Source (ALS) at the University of California, Berkeley.
â€¢ The system is powered by a large language model (LLM) and contributes to the stable operation of the accelerator and the efficiency of experiments.
â€¢ The introduction of AI allows researchers to focus on more complex experiments, accelerating scientific discovery.
content_en:
A groundbreaking AI system, 'Accelerator Assistant,' has been implemented at the Advanced Light Source (ALS) at the University of California, Berkeley. Based on a large language model (LLM), this system is responsible for the complex control and monitoring of the X-ray accelerator. Traditionally, maintaining the stable operation of an accelerator required the advanced knowledge and experience of skilled technicians, but the introduction of Accelerator Assistant has significantly reduced this burden. The AI analyzes data in real-time and optimizes accelerator parameters, improving the accuracy and efficiency of experiments. This allows researchers to focus on more complex experiments, greatly expanding the potential for new scientific discoveries. This initiative clearly demonstrates the role AI can play in the field of scientific research, and its future development is highly anticipated.

Review (EN)

Wow! AI controlling a particle accelerator? This feels straight out of science fiction. Expecting a huge boost in research speed. A great example for Japanese research institutions to embrace AI!

title_en: NVIDIA Unveils AI Blueprints to Revolutionize Retail: Intelligent Warehouses & Catalog Enrichment
summary_en:
â€¢ NVIDIA has announced AI solution blueprints specifically designed to address challenges in the retail industry.
â€¢ The goal is to improve warehouse efficiency and enhance customer experience through enriched product catalogs.
â€¢ AI will overcome issues such as aging systems and data silos.
content_en:
NVIDIA has unveiled blueprints for multi-agent intelligent warehouse management and catalog enrichment AI, aimed at resolving backend challenges within the retail industry. Currently, retailers face issues such as meeting shipping deadlines, correcting missing product details, and providing curated shopping experiences. These challenges are compounded by aging systems, data silos, and rising customer expectations. NVIDIAâ€™s new AI solutions aim to overcome these problems and optimize the entire retail pipeline, leading to a more efficient, consistent, and faster shopping experience. This announcement has the potential to accelerate digital transformation within the retail sector.

Review (EN)

Wow! NVIDIA's retail AI strategy is a game-changer. Automated warehouses & AI-powered catalogs? This is HUGE for the future of retail. ğŸš€

title_en: Acer Expands ProCreator Lineup with Versatile Dual-Mode 4K Monitor!
summary_en:
â€¢ Acer has added a more affordable 4K monitor, the PE270KT, to its ProCreator series.
â€¢ The PE270KT supports a dual mode of 4K/72Hz and Full HD/144Hz, offering flexibility based on usage.
â€¢ With 99% Adobe RGB/DCI-P3 coverage and Calman verification, it's ideal for professional creators.
content_en:
Acer has expanded its ProCreator line of monitors for professional creators with the PE270KT, a 27-inch IPS monitor. The PE270KT offers a unique dual-mode panel capable of running at 4K up to 72 Hz or switching to Full HD at 144 Hz via Dynamic Frame Rate (DFR). This flexibility allows users to optimize display settings based on their workflow. The monitor boasts 99% Adobe RGB and 99% DCI-P3 color coverage, and is Calman-verified, ensuring accurate color reproduction for demanding creative tasks. It also features 350 nits typical brightness (400 nits HDR peak) and VESA DisplayHDR 400 certification. Connectivity includes HDMI 2.1, DisplayPort 1.4, USB-C with 90 W power delivery, an integrated USB hub, Auto KVM support, an adjustable 8 MP webcam, and dual 5 W speakers. The PE270KT is priced at NT$15,980 in Taiwan (approximately â‚¬435), making it a more accessible option compared to the existing ProCreator PE270XT (starting at â‚¬899).

Review (EN)

Seriously impressive specs! The dual-mode functionality switching between 4K & 144Hz is a game-changer for creators. And the price? Fantastic!

title_en: Finally! Apple Moves to Mass Production of OLED MacBook Pro! A Revolution Begins in 2026?!
summary_en:
â€¢ Apple's next-generation MacBook Pro is expected to finally adopt an OLED display.
â€¢ Samsung Display has begun operating an 8.6-generation OLED production line and has started supplying panels for the MacBook Pro.
â€¢ A touchscreen, a punch-hole camera similar to the Dynamic Island, and the M6 chip are anticipated.
content_en:
Development of Apple's long-rumored OLED MacBook Pro has made significant progress. Samsung Display has begun operating its 8.6-generation OLED production line located at its Asan campus in South Korea, and has commenced panel production for the MacBook Pro. This production line utilizes larger glass substrates, enabling the efficient manufacturing of multiple laptop-sized panels. This is expected to reduce costs and improve yields. The OLED panels to be adopted will feature a rigid OLED panel, oxide TFT backplane, and advanced tandem OLED structure, delivering high brightness, excellent power efficiency, and a long lifespan. According to analyst Ming-Chi Kuo, this OLED MacBook Pro will feature a touchscreen, and Bloomberg's Mark Gurman also reports that it will have a thinner and lighter frame. Furthermore, there is a possibility that a punch-hole camera similar to the Dynamic Island will be adopted at the top of the display. This new MacBook Pro is expected to be powered by the M6 chip and launched from late 2026 to early 2027.

Review (EN)

Seriously impressive specs! An OLED display, touchscreen, and a Dynamic Island-like design on the MacBook Proâ€¦ I can't wait for 2026! The M6 chip's performance is also incredibly exciting. Apple's tech prowess continues to amaze.

title_en: AMD Pledges to Keep GPU Prices Low Despite DRAM Shortage â€“ Is This For Real?
summary_en:
â€¢ AMD has announced a strategy to keep GPU prices as low as possible amid the ongoing DRAM shortage fueled by the AI boom.
â€¢ The company is working with AIC partners and considers managing the memory ecosystem a core part of its strategy.
â€¢ AMD's efforts are noteworthy as other manufacturers are forced to raise prices.
content_en:
AMD has asserted its strategy to maintain GPU prices at the lowest possible level despite the current DRAM shortage and the resulting volatility in the PC market. This announcement is particularly significant given the anticipated GPU price increases driven by the surging DRAM demand from the AI boom. AMD intends to minimize the impact of rising costs by strengthening collaboration with AIC (Add-in Card) partners and positioning the management of the entire memory ecosystem as a core element of its strategy. While other manufacturers are raising prices citing increased material costs, the extent to which AMD can deliver on this strategy remains to be seen and is a key area of observation. This approach has the potential to significantly contribute to market stabilization.

Review (EN)

AMD promising to fight GPU price hikes during a DRAM shortage? That's a bold move! Let's see if they can actually pull it off. ğŸ”¥

title_en: BREAKING: Revolutionary Tech for iPhone Fold & 18 Pro Duo! A20 Pro Chip to Feature WMCM Packaging & SHPMIM Capacitors?
summary_en:
â€¢ Apple's upcoming A20 Pro chip is expected to power the iPhone Fold, iPhone 18 Pro, and iPhone 18 Pro Max.
â€¢ The chip will adopt WMCM packaging and new SHPMIM capacitors to improve stability, efficiency, and performance.
â€¢ According to GF Securities analyst Jeff Pu, Apple is predicted to ship 250 million iPhones in 2026.
content_en:
Significant technological advancements have been reported regarding Apple's upcoming A20 Pro chip, which will power the next-generation iPhone Fold, iPhone 18 Pro, and iPhone 18 Pro Max. According to GF Securities analyst Jeff Pu, the chip is expected to adopt WMCM (Wafer-on-MCEM) packaging, delivering higher performance and efficiency compared to traditional packaging methods. Furthermore, the integration of new SHPMIM (Super-High-Performance Metal-Insulator-Metal) capacitors is anticipated to significantly improve chip stability and power efficiency. Pu also predicts that Apple will ship 250 million iPhones in 2026, indicating a remarkable growth rate amidst a generally expected industry downturn. These technological innovations are expected to have a substantial impact on future iPhone series.

Review (EN)

Seriously impressive specs! The combination of WMCM packaging and SHPMIM capacitors has the potential to deliver a massive leap in both performance and efficiency. If the iPhone 18 Pro Duo truly packs this chip, it'll dominate the competition.

title_en: NVIDIA BioNeMo Revolutionizes Drug Discovery! Partnerships with Eli Lilly & Thermo Fisher Accelerate AI-Driven Innovation!
summary_en:
â€¢ NVIDIA BioNeMo platform adopted by leading life sciences companies like Eli Lilly and Thermo Fisher.
â€¢ Eli Lilly and NVIDIA launch a co-innovation lab to tackle challenges in AI-driven drug discovery.
â€¢ New Clara models and BioNeMo Recipes promise significant efficiency gains in the drug discovery process.
content_en:
NVIDIA has announced an expansion of BioNeMo, an open development platform designed to accelerate breakthroughs in AI-driven biology and drug discovery. The life sciences industry generates vast amounts of scientific data, and BioNeMo aims to enhance competitive discovery by enabling data generation, processing, model training, optimization, and deployment, while reducing R&D costs. The expansion includes new Clara open models, such as the RNAPro model for RNA structure prediction and the ReaSyn v2 model for ensuring the synthesizability of AI-designed drugs. BioNeMo Recipes for accelerating biological foundation model training, customization, and deployment, and data processing libraries like nvMolKit, a GPU-accelerated cheminformatics tool, are also provided. Eli Lilly is collaborating with NVIDIA to establish a co-innovation lab focused on AI-driven drug discovery challenges, while Thermo Fisher is partnering with NVIDIA to enhance the intelligence of scientific instruments and increase laboratory autonomy. This evolution of BioNeMo is expected to accelerate drug discovery by extracting valuable insights from experimental data and establishing a continuous learning cycle.

Review (EN)

This NVIDIA BioNeMo evolution is HUGE! Seeing industry leaders like Eli Lilly & Thermo Fisher adopt it speaks volumes. The future of AI drug discovery is accelerating NOW!

Today, it has been revealed that a lifetime license for Microsoft Office Professional 2021 for Windows is significantly discounted. Currently available for just $34.97, down from the standard price of $219.99. We strongly recommend seizing this opportunity to acquire a perpetually licensed copy of Office 2021 Professional.

title_en: NVIDIA Shifts to 'Profit/GB' Strategy Amid GPU Memory Shortages â€“ 8GB GPUs May Become Hot Picks!
summary_en:
â€¢ NVIDIA is potentially shifting to a 'Profit/GB' strategy due to GPU memory shortages.
â€¢ According to Gigabyte's CEO, NVIDIA is likely to prioritize more profitable 8GB models.
â€¢ This strategy could make the RTX 5060 Ti 16GB model less attractive compared to 8GB SKUs.
content_en:
NVIDIA is facing challenges due to GPU memory shortages, exacerbated by increasing demand from the datacenter sector. Statements from Gigabyte's CEO indicate that NVIDIA is considering a strategy focused on maximizing 'Profit/GB'. This potentially means prioritizing the supply of more profitable 8GB models over those with larger memory capacities. This shift could diminish the relative appeal of higher-priced models like the RTX 5060 Ti 16GB. Rumors of a potential discontinuation of the RTX 5070 Ti 16GB variant are also circulating, making NVIDIA's future product strategy a key area to watch. Given the ongoing memory constraints, NVIDIA's upcoming product lineup will be a development of significant interest.

Review (EN)

Wow, this strategy is a bit of a surprise! Prioritizing profit over memory capacity... But considering datacenter demand, it's a tough call for NVIDIA. I'm really excited to see how powerful the 8GB models will be!

title_en: Intel's Next-Gen Embedded 'Bartlett Lake' Benchmarked: First PassMark Results Show Performance Surpassing Core i5!
summary_en:
â€¢ Intel's next-generation 'Bartlett Lake' processor, featuring only P-cores, has been benchmarked for the first time on PassMark.
â€¢ It demonstrates over 20% higher multi-threaded performance compared to the Core i5-14400 and rivals the 14-core i5-14500.
â€¢ While primarily aimed at the embedded market, the performance of 'Bartlett Lake' could have implications for the desktop space.
content_en:
Benchmark results for an Intel 'Bartlett Lake' processor, featuring only P-cores, have been published on PassMark. This processor, equipped with 10 P-cores, demonstrates over 20% higher multi-threaded performance than the Core i5-14400. Furthermore, it rivals the performance of the 14-core i5-14500, making it a significant development. Intel has already released the 'E' and 'TE' SKUs of 'Bartlett Lake,' but the P-core-only models are yet to be launched. Designed primarily for the embedded market, its high performance generates considerable anticipation for future developments. Further details regarding specifications and release dates will require continued monitoring of future information.

Review (EN)

Seriously impressive specs! Even for an embedded processor, surpassing the Core i5 is a great sign for Intel's future desktop CPUs. The architecture is clearly evolving rapidly to achieve this performance with only P-cores!

title_en: BREAKING: RTX 5070 Revealed! High FPS AAA Gaming May Struggle Due to Memory Shortages?
summary_en:
â€¢ The ASUS Prime GeForce RTX 5070 has been announced, proving to be sufficiently powerful despite its compact size.
â€¢ NVIDIA is reportedly scaling back production of 16GB GPUs, prioritizing 8GB VRAM models (RTX 5060/5060 Ti).
â€¢ AAA gaming at respectable framerates may be challenging due to constraints in memory supply.
content_en:
The ASUS Prime GeForce RTX 5070 has been released, reported to deliver sufficient GPU horsepower within a compact design. However, NVIDIA is reportedly scaling back production on 16GB GPUs, prioritizing the 8GB VRAM models of the RTX 5060 and RTX 5060 Ti. This may lead to difficulties in acquiring graphics cards with 12GB or more of VRAM. While NVIDIA has confirmed they will not discontinue any RTX 5000 series models, they acknowledge memory supply constraints and are working to rectify the issue. This memory crisis could hinder the ability to enjoy AAA gaming at respectable framerates. Amazon Prime members are advised to purchase quickly before the price exceeds the MSRP of $549.99.

Review (EN)

The RTX 5070 reveal is a pleasant surprise! But the potential impact on AAA gaming due to memory shortages is concerning. Hoping NVIDIA addresses this quickly!

title_en: Rust Director Offers $25 Million to Amazon to Keep New World Alive! Shutdown Date Set for January 31, 2027!
summary_en:
â€¢ Amazon has set the end-of-service date for the MMO 'New World' to January 31, 2027.
â€¢ The director of Rust reportedly offered Amazon $25 million (approximately Â¥3.94 billion) to keep New World running.
â€¢ Amazon has already delisted New World from stores, preventing new players from joining.
content_en:
Amazon's gaming division announced just three months ago that no further content would be made for New World, and quietly canceled the in-development The Lord of the Rings MMO project. Yesterday, Amazon revealed that New World had been delisted from stores, making it unavailable for new purchases, and clarified the date the servers will go offline forever: January 31, 2027. While over a year away, having a definitive shutdown date is a particularly sad occurrence. Surprisingly, the director of Rust has reportedly offered Amazon $25 million to keep New World alive. Whether Amazon will accept this offer remains to be seen, but the gaming community is reacting with a variety of opinions. New World initially attracted many players upon release, but gradually lost its player base due to delayed updates and issues with game balance. This decision to end service may indicate that Amazon is considering withdrawing from the MMO market.

Review (EN)

Wow, $25 million from the Rust director is a huge offer! New World had potential, despite its issues. I'm really curious to see if Amazon will accept!

title_en: M5 Max Outperforms M3 Ultra? Shocking Leak Reveals Next-Gen Mac Chip Performance!
summary_en:
â€¢ Leaked scores suggest the M5 Max GPU could surpass the 80-core M3 Ultra.
â€¢ The M5 Max is projected to deliver a performance increase of over 34% compared to the M4 Max.
â€¢ The M5 Pro is also showing impressive scores, hinting at a significant performance boost across the next generation of Macs.
content_en:
Recent information indicates that the M5 Pro, M5 Max, and M5 Ultra are expected to be announced in the first half of this year. Leaked estimates of the M5 Max's gaming performance reveal it potentially surpasses a laptop RTX 5070 Ti GPU, significantly outpacing its predecessor, the M4 Max. Notably, Geekbench 6 Metal scores suggest that even an 80-core M3 Ultra is outperformed by the M5 Max. The M5 Pro is also demonstrating impressive scores, indicating a substantial performance increase across the next generation of Mac chips. This information reaffirms the relentless evolution of Apple silicon.

Seriously impressive specs! An M5 Max that beats the M3 Ultra? I can't wait to see what kind of experience that delivers. Hats off to Apple's engineering!

summary_en:
â€¢ Information potentially revealing a next-generation Switch model has been discovered on Nintendo's official website.
â€¢ Nintendo has experienced frequent information leaks in recent years, highlighting the urgent need for strengthened security measures.
â€¢ This leak could further fuel anticipation for the next Switch console.
content_en:
Nintendo has historically been a highly secretive company, taking a firm stance against leaks. However, in recent years, a significant amount of information, including details about the next Switch console, has been leaked online prior to official announcements. This incident involves the discovery of information on Nintendo's official website that potentially reveals a next-generation Switch model. This suggests a vulnerability in Nintendo's security infrastructure and necessitates immediate action. Continued leaks not only impact Nintendo's product development plans but also risk disappointing consumers. Nintendo's response to this situation will be closely watched.

Nintendo's security is concerning, but if this is the next Switch, the performance boost could be huge! Fingers crossed for a full reveal soon.

review_en: A $500B investment is HUGE! But keeping leading-edge chips in Taiwan isâ€¦ complicated. Seems like a balance between US self-sufficiency & TSMC's tech dominance. Watching closely!
title_en: TSMC to Invest $500 Billion in US, But Leading-Edge Chips Remain Offshore?
summary_en:
â€¢ TSMC and the Taiwanese government have announced a $500 billion investment plan for semiconductor manufacturing in the US.
â€¢ While this investment aims to strengthen the US semiconductor industry, the production of the most advanced chips will still take place in Taiwan.
â€¢ The US has reached a trade agreement with Taiwan, aiming for tariff treatment equivalent to that of Japan and South Korea.
content_en:
TSMC and the Taiwanese government have reached an agreement to invest a massive $500 billion (approximately Â¥79 trillion) in semiconductor manufacturing within the United States. While this investment is intended to bolster the US semiconductor industry, reports indicate that the chips produced will be at the 'N-2' technology level, not the most cutting-edge. This means the most advanced chip manufacturing technology will remain in Taiwan. This appears to contradict the US policy of increasing semiconductor self-sufficiency, however, TSMC is actively expanding its operations in Arizona. Furthermore, the US government has reached a trade agreement with Taiwan, granting it tariff treatment equivalent to that of Japan and South Korea, likely to encourage further investment. This trade deal, announced by the Trump administration, has the potential to significantly impact US-Taiwan relations.

Review (EN)

A $500B investment is HUGE! But keeping leading-edge chips in Taiwan isâ€¦ complicated. Seems like a balance between US self-sufficiency & TSMC's tech dominance. Watching closely!

title_en: BREAKING: iPhone Fold & iPhone 18 Pro to Feature Next-Gen A20 Pro Chip with Massive Performance Leap!
summary_en:
â€¢ The iPhone Fold and iPhone 18 Pro will reportedly feature the A20 Pro chip built on TSMC's 2nm 'N2' process.
â€¢ The A20 Pro chip utilizes WMCM technology to integrate RAM with the CPU/GPU, enhancing Apple Intelligence performance and extending battery life.
â€¢ The iPhone Fold is rumored to boast a 7.8-inch inner display and a 5.5-inch outer display, potentially achieving a slim 4.5mm thickness.
content_en:
According to industry analyst Jeff Pu, Apple's foldable iPhone (iPhone Fold) and iPhone 18 Pro/Pro Max models are slated to feature the next-generation A20 Pro chip upon their September release. This A20 Pro chip will be built on TSMC's latest 2nm process, 'N2,' promising performance improvements of up to 15% faster and 30% more power-efficient compared to the A19 chip. Notably, the adoption of TSMC's Wafer-Level Multi-Chip Module (WMCM) technology is a key highlight. This integrates RAM directly onto the same wafer as the CPU, GPU, and Neural Engine, enabling faster data transfer than traditional silicon interposer connections. The implementation of WMCM is expected to contribute to enhanced Apple Intelligence performance, extended battery life, and a smaller A20 chip footprint, allowing for more efficient use of space within the iPhone. Furthermore, the N2 process introduces new super-high-performance metal-insulator-metal (SHPMIM) capacitors, anticipated to improve power delivery stability, boost performance, and enhance energy efficiency. Pu's report also suggests that the Pro models and Fold model will share 12GB of LPD5 RAM, 48MP rear cameras, and Apple's C2 modem. The iPhone Fold is expected to feature a book-style design with a 7.8-inch inner display and a 5.5-inch outer display, potentially achieving a folded thickness of just 4.5mm and an unfolded thickness of 9mm-9.5mm.

Review (EN)

Honestly, these specs are incredible! The WMCM implementation, in particular, will be a game-changer for future iPhone performance. The thinness of the foldable iPhone also showcases Apple's engineering prowess. Can't wait!

title_en: Brook Gaming Launches Wingman P5: Universal Controller Adapter for PS5, PS4 & PC!
summary_en:
â€¢ Native support for Xbox Elite Series 2, PS4, and Switch Pro controllers on PS5!
â€¢ Proprietary Direct Connection Technology delivers near-zero latency.
â€¢ No complex Remote Play setup required â€“ plug and play simplicity.
content_en:
Brook Gaming today announced the global launch of the Wingman P5, a high-performance controller adapter enabling the use of a wide range of controllers on PS5, PS4, and PC (X-Input). The adapter allows users to natively utilize professional-grade controllers such as the Xbox Elite Series 2, PS4, and Switch Pro controllers on the PS5. Unlike existing solutions relying on lag-inducing Remote Play workarounds, the Wingman P5 leverages proprietary Direct Connection Technology, delivering near-zero latency. This ensures optimal performance for both casual and competitive gamers across all genres. Its plug-and-play functionality further enhances user convenience.

Review (EN)

Seriously impressive specs! This is a game-changer for anyone struggling with controller compatibility. The low-latency Direct Connection Tech is a huge win, especially for competitive players. Brook Gaming continues to innovate!

title_en: HDD Prices Skyrocket! 46% Increase in Four Months â€“ Driven by High Demand?
summary_en:
â€¢ HDD prices have increased by an average of 46% over the past four months.
â€¢ The Toshiba 22TB model saw a significant price increase of 66%.
â€¢ The price hike is primarily attributed to high demand, unrelated to semiconductor shortages.
content_en:
This is a surprising news report indicating that HDD prices have risen by an average of 46% over the past four months. According to ComputerBase's tracker, the increase ranges from 23% to 66% depending on the model, but overall prices are soaring. Specifically, the Toshiba Cloud Scale Capacity MG10F AFA 22 TB model experienced a significant 66% increase. This price surge is primarily attributed to strong demand for HDDs, unrelated to semiconductor shortages. As HDDs utilize minimal silicon for storage, their price movements diverge from the semiconductor industry. DigiTimes reports a 4% price increase in HDD contracts for Q4 2025, contributing to the observed 46% overall increase. This situation could significantly impact data centers and NAS users.

Review (EN)

Wow, a 46% price jump in HDDs is unexpected! The 66% increase on the 22TB model is wild. Data center & NAS builders, take note â€“ act fast!

title_en: ASUS ProArt Displays Unleash Mac-Focused Features for Enhanced Workflows!
summary_en:
â€¢ ASUS DisplayWidget Center software now supports macOS, enabling intuitive monitor settings.
â€¢ Display brightness can now be adjusted directly via MacBook shortcut buttons.
â€¢ New M Model P3 color settings improve color reproduction consistency with MacBooks, ensuring accurate color fidelity.
content_en:
ASUS today announced new features on ProArt displays designed to enhance productivity and creative workflows for MacBook, Mac Mini, and Mac Studio users. The ASUS DisplayWidget Center software for macOS provides an intuitive interface for easily adjusting monitor settings, including brightness, contrast, and color temperature. The software also enables direct brightness control via MacBook shortcut buttons. Furthermore, new M Model P3 color settings align monitor colors with MacBooks, ensuring consistent color accuracy. High-resolution, high-pixel-density ProArt displays allow users to fully leverage the exceptional graphics capabilities of the latest Mac devices. This represents a significant update for Mac users.

Review (EN)

This enhanced MacBook integration is incredible! The DisplayWidget Center is a game-changer for Mac users. Color management improvements are a huge win for creators. ASUS ProArt displays are a top pick for anyone maximizing their Mac setup!

review_en: Seriously impressive specs for the Rock series! Standard Wi-Fi 7 and PCIe 5.0 support at this price point is fantastic. A must-consider for any DIY PC builder. Great job, ASRock!
title_en: ASRock Unveils New Rock Series Motherboards! Wi-Fi 7 Models Also Included!
summary_en:
â€¢ ASRock has announced a new lineup of Rock series motherboards aimed at DIY PC builders.
â€¢ Models based on the B850/B860 chipsets will be available in both ATX and MicroATX form factors.
â€¢ Equipped with the latest features such as Wi-Fi 7, 2.5GbE, and PCIe 5.0, offering excellent cost performance.
content_en:
ASRock today announced the latest lineup of its Rock series, engineered to provide comprehensive solutions for PC DIY builders. The lineup includes the B850 Rock WiFi 7 and B860 Rock WiFi 7 in ATX form factor, and the B850M Rock WiFi and B860M Rock WiFi in MicroATX form factor. These motherboards balance reliable performance with a clean aesthetic, all while maintaining an accessible price point. Key aspects of the Rock series are functionality and practicality. Every Rock series motherboard comes standard with built-in Wi-Fi, 2.5GbE networking, PCIe 5.0 support, and a DIY-friendly pre-installed I/O shield, delivering a well-balanced solution for daily PC builds. The ATX models, B850 Rock WiFi 7 and B860 Rock WiFi 7, further enhance connectivity with Wi-Fi 7 support.

Review (EN)

Seriously impressive specs for the Rock series! Standard Wi-Fi 7 and PCIe 5.0 support at this price point is fantastic. A must-consider for any DIY PC builder. Great job, ASRock!

review_en: Cygames' commitment to transparency with fans regarding AI implementation is a huge win! Shows they value their community. Excited to see what Cygames AI Studio delivers!
title_en: Cygames Vows Prior Notice for AI Implementation Following Fan Backlash, Explains AI Studio's Purpose
summary_en:
â€¢ Cygames has established a new subsidiary, 'Cygames AI Studio,' dedicated to AI technology development.
â€¢ Following concerns from fans regarding AI implementation, Cygames has pledged to provide prior notice.
â€¢ The AI Studio aims to expand creator creativity, going beyond simple efficiency improvements.
content_en:
Cygames, a Japanese developer renowned for franchises such as 'Granblue Fantasy,' 'Shadowverse,' and 'Umamusume: Pretty Derby,' recently faced significant backlash from its fanbase following the announcement of a new subsidiary, Cygames AI Studio. Announced last week, Cygames AI Studio is a division dedicated to the safe and secure pursuit of AI technology for creators, leveraging the company's extensive experience in game development. Cygames aims to establish a 'unique creative cycle' that extends beyond mere efficiency gains to enhance creator creativity. In response to fan concerns, the company has vowed to provide prior notice before implementing any generative AI into its games. This is a crucial step to address community anxieties and demonstrates a commitment to transparency.

Review (EN)

Cygames' commitment to transparency with fans regarding AI implementation is a huge win! Shows they value their community. Excited to see what Cygames AI Studio delivers!

review_en: A potential RTX 50 series cancellation is absolutely shocking! The memory shortage is clearly more severe than anticipated. This could throw the high-end GPU market into chaos. Waiting for NVIDIA's official statement!
title_en: BREAKING: NVIDIA RTX 50 Series Facing Potential Cancellation? Memory Shortages Heavily Impact Prices & Supply! A Deep Dive.
summary_en:
â€¢ Memory shortages may be severely impacting the production of NVIDIA RTX 50 series GPUs.
â€¢ The memory crisis is reportedly forcing both NVIDIA and AMD to raise prices.
â€¢ Sources suggest rumors are circulating regarding the potential End of Life (EOL) of the RTX 50 series.
content_en:
Recent reports indicate that memory shortages are significantly impacting the supply and pricing of NVIDIA's RTX 50 series GPUs. Since the memory crisis surfaced in November 2023, GPU vendors NVIDIA and AMD have been forced to increase prices, and rumors of an End of Life (EOL) for the RTX 50 series are now circulating. This report provides a detailed analysis of the situation and forecasts potential future developments. Sources suggest that the difficulty in procuring memory may delay the planned production schedule for the RTX 50 series, potentially pushing back the launch date considerably. Furthermore, the rising cost of memory is likely to be reflected in the final product price, increasing the burden on consumers. NVIDIA's future actions are now under close scrutiny.

Review (EN)

A potential RTX 50 series cancellation is absolutely shocking! The memory shortage is clearly more severe than anticipated. This could throw the high-end GPU market into chaos. Waiting for NVIDIA's official statement!

review_en: Honestly, this news is super interesting! Gigabyte has strong hardware design capabilities, so I'm expecting an innovative product that stands out from existing handhelds. Their focus on differentiation is crucial for promoting market diversity. Personally, I'm hoping for a model with significantly improved cooling or one that adopts a completely new input method!
title_en: Gigabyte CEO Cautious on Handheld Entry: 'Differentiation' is Key!
summary_en:
â€¢ Gigabyte CEO points out the similarity of existing handheld gaming devices.
â€¢ The company is considering a product with unique differentiating factors, rather than simple imitation.
â€¢ The CEO specifically cited Chinese handheld manufacturers as examples, emphasizing a desire to avoid easy replication.
content_en:
Gigabyte CEO Eddie Lin recently discussed the company's hesitation to release an Aorus gaming handheld in an interview with PCWorld. According to Mr. Lin, while the gaming handheld market has grown with the popularity of devices like the Steam Deck, ASUS ROG Ally, and Lenovo Legion Go, many products are remarkably similar in design and specifications. Gigabyte is considering entering the handheld market, but aims to develop a product with clear differentiating factors rather than simply following existing templates. He specifically cited Chinese handheld manufacturers such as Ayaneo, OneXPlayer, and GPD, noting that it is easy to manufacture products along the template they have established. Mr. Lin stated that even seemingly unique designs, such as the GPD Win 5 and OneXPlayer OneXFly Apex, share a similar basic structure. Gigabyte aims to avoid market saturation and develop a product that can offer unique value.

Review (EN)

Honestly, this news is super interesting! Gigabyte has strong hardware design capabilities, so I'm expecting an innovative product that stands out from existing handhelds. Their focus on differentiation is crucial for promoting market diversity. Personally, I'm hoping for a model with significantly improved cooling or one that adopts a completely new input method!

title_en: Shohei Ohtani Stars in Beats' New Ad Campaign, Dominating the LA Skyline
summary_en:
â€¢ Beats by Dre has launched its latest ad campaign featuring Los Angeles Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani.
â€¢ The campaign, in collaboration with photographer Daniel Sannwald, portrays a massively oversized Ohtani against iconic LA backdrops.
â€¢ The latest Beats products, including the Beats Studio Pro, Powerbeats Pro 2, and Powerbeats Fit, are featured in the advertisement.
content_en:
Beats by Dre has announced its latest advertising campaign featuring Los Angeles Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani. Created in collaboration with photographer Daniel Sannwald, the campaign portrays Ohtani on a massive scale, emphasizing his presence against iconic Los Angeles backdrops. The ad imagery showcases Ohtani wearing the latest Beats products, including the Beats Studio Pro, Powerbeats Pro 2, and Powerbeats Fit, creating a world where sport and culture intersect against the LA cityscape. Ohtani commented, â€œLos Angeles is a city of energy, culture, and ambition. Wearing Beats and seeing myself rise above the skyline feels symbolic of the connection I have with this city and our fans.â€ The campaign effectively merges Beatsâ€™ brand identity â€“ encompassing sports, music, and entertainment â€“ with Ohtaniâ€™s ambition, performance, and boldness.

Review (EN)

This Ohtani x Beats collab is HUGE! The scale and LA backdrop are incredible. As a gadget fan, I'm totally sold!

review_en: Wow, this is a shock! New World had a beautiful aesthetic and unique gameplay, but couldn't retain its player base. Amazon's shift in AAA gaming strategy could have a big impact on the industry.
title_en: Amazon's 'New World: Aeternum' to Shut Down in January 2027! The End of a Major MMO?
summary_en:
â€¢ Amazon has decided to withdraw from AAA game development and has halted new content development for 'New World: Aeternum'.
â€¢ The game will be delisted from stores on January 15, 2026, and service will end completely on January 31, 2027.
â€¢ Amazon will offer refunds to players who purchased the game (subject to Steam's refund policies).
content_en:
Amazon Games has announced the shutdown of 'New World: Aeternum'. Following the announcement in October 2025 of a shift away from AAA game development, rumors of a shutdown circulated, but it is now confirmed that service will end in January 2027. The game will be delisted from stores on January 15, 2026, and will remain playable until January 31, 2027, but in-game purchases will no longer be possible after July 20, 2026. The game is currently unavailable for purchase on Steam, and Amazon is recommending that purchasers contact support for refunds. Steam's policy allows for automatic refunds if the game has been played for less than two hours or purchased within two weeks. The game peaked at 51,031 concurrent players on Steam, but has since fallen to around 1,200 daily players. The final season, 'Nighthaven', will be extended until the service ends.

Review (EN)

Wow, this is a shock! New World had a beautiful aesthetic and unique gameplay, but couldn't retain its player base. Amazon's shift in AAA gaming strategy could have a big impact on the industry.

review_en: The hype for the Xe3P architecture is real! Nova Lake-S in the Core Ultra 400 could mean a massive leap in integrated graphics performance â€“ I'm incredibly excited.
title_en: Intel's Next-Gen GPUs 'Nova Lake-S' and 'Crescent Island' Supported in Graphics Compiler â€“ Xe3P Architecture Details Emerge?
summary_en:
â€¢ Support for Intel's next-generation data center GPU 'Crescent Island (CRI)' and desktop 'Nova Lake-S (NVL-S)' has been added to the latest graphics compiler.
â€¢ Both products will utilize the Intel Xe3P graphics architecture, promising a significant performance boost over the current 'Panther Lake'.
â€¢ The codename 'Wildcat Lake' processor series was also discovered, sparking interest in its relationship with the 'Panther Lake-H' APUs announced at CES 2026.
content_en:
Intel has released the latest version of its Graphics Compiler (IGC), v2.27.10. According to a discovery by Phoronix's Michael Larabel, this update includes initial support for the next-generation data center GPU, officially abbreviated as 'Crescent Island (CRI)'. Furthermore, an identifier for 'Nova Lake-S (NVL-S)' was also found. Both products are reported to share the Intel Xe3P graphics architecture. Within the compiler's 'c430f67' commitment, an 'NVL_XE3G' enablement is present for Intel's next-generation desktop processor series. 'Core Ultra 400/Nova Lake-S' chips are expected to feature an Xe3P-based Arc integrated graphics solution, a more advanced architecture than the Xe3-blessed Arc iGPU in the 'Panther Lake' design. Days later, Larabel discovered further 'Nova Lake-S' and 'Crescent Island' entries, resulting in a report focused on the Intel Compute Runtime v26.01.36711.4 update. A multitude of familiar codenames were noted, but the addition of Team Blue's 'Wildcat Lake' raised an eyebrow. This lower-end mobile processor series was largely overshadowed by the closely related 'Panther Lake-H' APUs at CES 2026.

Review (EN)

The hype for the Xe3P architecture is real! Nova Lake-S in the Core Ultra 400 could mean a massive leap in integrated graphics performance â€“ I'm incredibly excited.

â€¢ GeForce NOW now supports native Linux apps and Amazon Fire TV Sticks.
â€¢ Flight simulator control support has been added, enabling a more immersive gaming experience.

content_en:
NVIDIA announced the latest updates for GeForce NOW at CES 2026. The key highlights include native app support for Linux and Amazon Fire TV Sticks, expanding accessibility to a wider user base. Furthermore, requested flight simulator control support has been implemented, enhancing the gaming experience. The addition of popular titles from Devolver Digital to the GeForce NOW library significantly enriches the cloud gaming lineup. Creators from YouTube channels such as Cloud Gaming Battle and Anytime are also covering this news. This is a significant update that greatly expands the potential of cloud gaming.

review_en: Seriously hyped for the Xe3P architecture! Can't wait to see what performance Nova Lake-S and Crescent Island deliver. The emergence of Wildcat Lake is also a good sign for market diversity!
title_en: Intel's Next-Gen GPUs 'Nova Lake-S' & 'Crescent Island' Supported in Compiler Update â€“ Xe3P Architecture Details Emerge!
summary_en:
â€¢ Initial support for Intel's next-generation data center GPU 'Crescent Island' (CRI) and desktop 'Nova Lake-S' (NVL-S) has been added to the Intel Graphics Compiler (IGC) v2.27.10.
â€¢ Both products will utilize the Intel Xe3P graphics architecture, promising significant performance improvements over the current 'Panther Lake'.
â€¢ The codename 'Wildcat Lake' processor series was also discovered, sparking interest in its relationship to the 'Panther Lake-H' APUs announced at CES 2026.
content_en:
Intel has released the latest version of its Graphics Compiler (IGC), v2.27.10. Noted by Phoronix's Michael Larabel, the update quietly added initial support for the next-generation data center GPU, 'Crescent Island' (CRI). He also discovered an identifier for 'Nova Lake-S' (NVL-S). Both product lines are reported to share a commonality: their utilization of the Intel Xe3P graphics architecture. Within the compiler's 'c430f67' commitment, an 'NVL_XE3G' enablement is present for Intel's next-gen desktop processor series. 'Core Ultra 400/Nova Lake-S' chips are expected to feature an Xe3P-based Arc integrated graphics solution, a more advanced architecture than the 'Panther Lake' design's merely Xe3-blessed Arc iGPU. Days later, Larabel discovered further 'Nova Lake-S' and 'Crescent Island' entries, resulting in a report focusing on the Intel Compute Runtime v26.01.36711.4 update. A multitude of familiar codenames were noted (see screenshot below), but the addition of Intel's 'Wildcat Lake' raised an eyebrow. This lower-end mobile processor series was largely overshadowed by the closely related 'Panther Lake-H' APUs at CES 2026.

Review (EN)

Seriously hyped for the Xe3P architecture! Can't wait to see what performance Nova Lake-S and Crescent Island deliver. The emergence of Wildcat Lake is also a good sign for market diversity!

review_en: Wow, this is a fascinating take! The impact of remote work on game dev is debated, but a former CEO highlighting efficiency & creativity drops is a big deal. Rethinking how games are made!
title_en: Ex-Tripwire CEO Links Game Delays to Remote Work: A Deep Dive into Industry-Wide Issues
summary_en:
â€¢ Former Tripwire CEO John Gibson attributes recent game delays and industry layoffs to the impact of COVID-19.
â€¢ Gibson believes remote work reduces employee efficiency and creativity, contributing to development setbacks.
â€¢ A pandemic-era hiring spree and inflated salaries are also cited as factors driving the current industry adjustments.
content_en:
This report is based on an interview with former Tripwire Interactive CEO John Gibson. Gibson states that the recent game development delays and industry-wide layoffs are largely attributable to the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. Specifically, he believes that the remote work arrangements popularized by the pandemic tend to decrease employee efficiency and creativity, leading to development setbacks. He cites the five-year development cycle of Killing Floor 3 as a concrete example. Furthermore, the large-scale hiring sprees and subsequent salary inflation during the pandemic are also identified as contributing factors to the current industry adjustments. This situation is impacting the entire gaming industry, and future trends are being closely watched.

Review (EN)

Wow, this is a fascinating take! The impact of remote work on game dev is debated, but a former CEO highlighting efficiency & creativity drops is a big deal. Rethinking how games are made!

review_en: Keychron's wood keyboard is incredible! The balance of design and functionality is superb. The typing feel is excellent despite the low profile. Highly customizable too â€“ a must-check for any mechanical keyboard enthusiast!
title_en: Keychron Launches K3 Max All-Wood Edition Low-Profile Mechanical Keyboard!
summary_en:
â€¢ Keychron has announced the 'K3 Max All-Wood Edition' featuring a walnut wood enclosure.
â€¢ The ultra-thin, low-profile design maintains a height increase of only approximately 3mm over the standard model.
â€¢ It features Keychron Milk POM low-profile switches and supports Gateron KS-33 hot-swappable sockets.
content_en:
Keychron has been consistently innovating with unconventional keyboard case materials, having previously released models with ceramic, wood, concrete, and marble enclosures. The newly announced 'K3 Max All-Wood Edition' builds upon the popular K3 Max 75% low-profile mechanical keyboard, incorporating a walnut wood case and the new Keychron Milk POM low-profile switches. Unlike the K2 HE All-Wood Special Edition, this model avoids the issue of excessive front height, measuring only 20.2mm including keycaps â€“ a mere 3mm taller than the standard K3 Max. It is priced at $119.99 and is available with either Milk POM linear red or tactile brown switches. The keyboard utilizes Gateron KS-33 hot-swap sockets, allowing for aftermarket switch upgrades. It supports both 2.4 GHz and Bluetooth 5.2 wireless connectivity and features a 1550 mAh battery.

Review (EN)

Keychron's wood keyboard is incredible! The balance of design and functionality is superb. The typing feel is excellent despite the low profile. Highly customizable too â€“ a must-check for any mechanical keyboard enthusiast!

review_en: Seven classes is incredible! The 'Rook' solo-queue class is a brilliant way to jump in and out. Bungie's passion for game design shines through! Can't wait for Marathon's release!
title_en: Marathon Reveals Deep Dive into Seven Runner Classes, Including Solo-Queue Exclusive 'Rook'!
summary_en:
â€¢ Bungie's upcoming Marathon game has revealed details on the seven playable Runner classes (Destroyer, Assassin, Recon, Vandal, Thief, Triage, Rook).
â€¢ Each class boasts unique abilities and playstyles, enabling strategic gameplay.
â€¢ The 'Rook' class is exclusive to solo players, allowing them to join ongoing matches, acquire loot, and exit.
content_en:
Bungie has debuted its latest deep dive into Marathon with a new 'Developer Insights' video. The video details all seven of the different Runner Shells, which essentially act as the classes that players will be able to choose from. These include the Destroyer, Assassin, Recon, Vandal, Thief, and Triage classes, each possessing unique abilities, skills, and strengths. This allows players to select a class that aligns with their preferred playstyle. The seventh shell, Rook, is a solo-queue-only class that lets players jump into ongoing matches, grab loot, and exit. This Rook class presents an appealing option for solo players. This information release further builds anticipation for the diverse gameplay and strategic depth of Marathon.

Review (EN)

Seven classes is incredible! The 'Rook' solo-queue class is a brilliant way to jump in and out. Bungie's passion for game design shines through! Can't wait for Marathon's release!

review_en: AMD fighting to keep Radeon prices stable despite memory chaos? Huge win for gamers! And Zen 3 making a comeback? Color me hyped!
title_en: AMD Closely Monitoring Memory Market & Collaborating with AIBs to Stabilize Radeon Prices
summary_en:
â€¢ AMD is strengthening its strategic partnerships with DRAM manufacturers to address volatile memory market conditions.
â€¢ Despite anticipated price increases for the Radeon RX 9000 series, AMD intends to maintain MSRPs through collaboration with AIB partners.
â€¢ At CES 2026, AMD revealed it is considering a return to select 'Zen 3' AM4 desktop processors.
content_en:
AMD VP and GM David McAfee revealed during CES 2026 interviews that the company is actively managing memory supply and pricing through long-standing strategic partnerships with DRAM manufacturers, responding to the volatile memory market. He emphasized that appropriate memory pricing is crucial for maintaining graphics card prices and highlighted the importance of collaboration with AIB partners. While acknowledging the difficulty of predicting future market trends, McAfee expressed confidence that current partnerships will aid in price stabilization. Furthermore, AMD is exploring the potential re-introduction of select 'Zen 3' AM4 processors, likely as a strategy to address legacy markets and cater to diverse customer needs.

Review (EN)

title_en: Trails Beyond the Horizon PC Release Details Reveal New 'Transparent UI VFX Anti-Aliasing' Feature!
summary_en:
â€¢ The PC version of Trails Beyond the Horizon has been released today.
â€¢ This title inherits the extensive features implemented in the PC versions of Trails through Daybreak 1 & 2, and adds new functionalities.
â€¢ Notably, the new 'Transparent UI VFX Anti-Aliasing' setting specifically targets transparent UI elements.
content_en:
Trails Beyond the Horizon was released today. The PC version builds upon the technical foundations established in Trails through Daybreak 1 & 2, incorporating numerous features and improvements. In addition to existing functionalities such as in-game anti-aliasing, minimap anti-aliasing, and portrait supersampling, a new 'Transparent UI VFX Anti-Aliasing' option has been introduced. This feature specifically addresses the rendering quality of transparent UI elements, which were previously not effectively handled by existing anti-aliasing methods. The development team has demonstrated a strong commitment to enhancing the PC experience, and this release is a testament to their efforts. Further updates are anticipated with great interest.

Review (EN)

Seriously impressed by the Transparent UI VFX Anti-Aliasing! Finally, those jagged UI edges are gone â€“ you can really feel the developer's dedication. The Trails series PC ports are consistently top-notch!

title_en: Amazon Announces New World Aeternum Shutdown! Game to End in January 2027!
summary_en:
â€¢ Amazon has ceased development of new content for New World Aeternum, effectively ending service for the game.
â€¢ The game was delisted from digital stores today, January 15, 2026.
â€¢ Final service termination is scheduled for January 31, 2027.
content_en:
Today, Amazon announced the end of service for the massively multiplayer online role-playing game, *New World Aeternum*. Following the prior cessation of new content development, the game has been delisted from digital stores effective today and will be taken completely offline on January 31, 2027. Amazon stated in an official blog post that they wanted to provide transparency regarding the future direction of the game. However, the content effectively signals the end of service. This decision, occurring as players were beginning to return to the game, is particularly disappointing.

Review (EN)

Really sad to see New World Aeternum go. Had potential, but Amazon made the call. A shame after seeing some improvements!

summary_en:
â€¢ A battery service visit for a 2018 MacBook Pro resulted in an unexpected stroke of luck.
â€¢ A customer reportedly received a $4,000+ M4 Max MacBook Pro at no cost.
â€¢ This incident suggests an exceptional level of customer service at the Apple Store.
content_en:
On January 16, 2026, a report surfaced detailing an extraordinary incident where a 2018 MacBook Pro owner received a complimentary upgrade to a brand-new MacBook Pro equipped with the M4 Max chip, valued at over $4,000, during a routine battery service visit at an Apple Store. The M4 Max is renowned for its exceptional performance and efficiency, rivaling desktop-class processors. While a 16-inch MacBook Pro (14-core CPU, 32-core GPU) typically retails for $3,499 or more on Amazon, this customer secured the high-performance machine without any additional cost. This incident appears to be an exceptional case of customer service at the Apple Store. The specific details surrounding the event remain unclear, but the news is generating significant buzz among MacBook Pro users.

Seriously, these specs are insane! Getting an M4 Max for free is like a dream come true. Apple Store service is next level! ğŸ”¥

title_en: iPhone 18 Pro: 12 Revolutionary New Features! Launching September 2026
summary_en:
â€¢ The inclusion of under-display Face ID could significantly improve the screen-to-body ratio.
â€¢ The A20 Pro chip is expected to be manufactured using TSMC's 2nm process, resulting in a dramatic performance boost.
â€¢ The addition of satellite-based web browsing could free users from communication environment limitations.
content_en:
According to an article on MacRumors.com, the iPhone 18 Pro and iPhone 18 Pro Max are expected to launch in September 2026. The design will be largely similar to current models, featuring 6.3-inch and 6.9-inch display sizes, and a 'plateau' housing for three rear cameras. A key highlight is the potential inclusion of under-display Face ID, which could significantly improve the screen-to-body ratio. The front camera is also expected to be positioned in the top-left corner of the screen. Camera functionality will be enhanced with a variable aperture rumored for at least one rear camera. Processing power is anticipated to increase dramatically with the A20 Pro chip, manufactured using TSMC's 2nm process. Furthermore, support for 5G/LTE connectivity via Apple's custom-designed C1X or C2 modem, and Wi-Fi 7, Bluetooth 6, and Thread via the N1 chip or newer, is planned. As an innovative feature, satellite-based web browsing is also being considered. Color options currently under consideration include burgundy, brown, and purple. The iPhone 18 Pro Max may be slightly thicker to accommodate a larger battery.

Review (EN)

Honestly, these specs are incredible! The 2nm process for the A20 Pro chip and under-display Face ID will massively accelerate iPhone evolution. Satellite communication is also a huge plus for emergencies and remote areas. Can't wait for September!

title_en: Apple Adjusts Trade-In Values: Mac Trade-Ins See Significant Increase!
summary_en:
â€¢ Apple has updated its trade-in values for iPhones, iPads, Macs, and Apple Watches.
â€¢ iPhone trade-in values have decreased slightly, while Mac trade-in values have increased significantly.
â€¢ The increases in trade-in value are particularly notable for the MacBook Pro and Mac Pro.
content_en:
Apple today adjusted its trade-in values for select iPhone, iPad, Mac, and Apple Watch models. Trade-ins can be completed on Apple's website or at an Apple Store. While iPhone trade-in values have decreased slightly overall, Mac trade-in values have increased significantly. Notably, the MacBook Pro saw an increase of up to $1,755, and the Mac Pro up to $2,455. The reason for the previously low Mac trade-in values remains unclear, but this adjustment brings the values to a more realistic level. Price fluctuations for iPads and Apple Watches were relatively minor. This change is highly appealing news for users considering an upgrade to Apple products.

Review (EN)

Wow, the massive increase in Mac trade-in values is incredible! This might be the perfect time to upgrade, especially for MacBook Pro and Mac Pro owners! Apple's likely pushing for upgrades, but it's a win for consumers!

review_en: Fallout 76 was a bit of a letdown, honestly. While it's bittersweet to think of Bethesda letting go of the IP, I'm hopeful a new developer could deliver amazing Fallout/Elder Scrolls experiences!
title_en: Fallout/Elder Scrolls Series: Call for Sale from Bethesda! Lead Developer Voices Concerns
summary_en:
â€¢ Dean Carter, lead developer of Fallout London, suggests Bethesda should sell its IPs.
â€¢ He expresses dissatisfaction with the writing quality of recent Fallout and Elder Scrolls games.
â€¢ The lack of consideration for single-player fans with Fallout 76 is also a point of criticism.
content_en:
On January 16, 2026, Dean Carter, lead developer of Team FOLON, the studio behind Fallout London, stated in an interview with Esports.net that Bethesda should consider selling its IPs, including Fallout and Elder Scrolls. This suggestion stems from dissatisfaction with the writing quality of recent games, particularly the perceived lack of consideration for single-player fans with Fallout 76. Carter expressed his view with respect for Bethesda, but feels they may have â€œgone one step too far.â€ This follows a previous statement from renowned game designer Chris Avellone, who also expressed concerns that Bethesda did not fully understand the Fallout franchise. This series of statements suggests growing industry concern regarding Bethesdaâ€™s direction.

Review (EN)

Fallout 76 was a bit of a letdown, honestly. While it's bittersweet to think of Bethesda letting go of the IP, I'm hopeful a new developer could deliver amazing Fallout/Elder Scrolls experiences!

review_en: Absolutely insane specs! Arrow Lake Refresh has the potential to leave AMD in the dust. The multi-core gains are particularly impressive. Can't wait to see what this means for gaming PCs!
title_en: Intel's Next-Gen 'Arrow Lake Refresh' CPU Leaks: Core Ultra 9 290K Plus Dominates Geekbench!
summary_en:
â€¢ Geekbench scores for Intel's next-generation 'Arrow Lake Refresh' flagship, the Core Ultra 9 290K Plus, have been leaked.
â€¢ The 290K Plus shows approximately a 7% improvement in single-core performance and a 9% improvement in multi-core performance compared to the existing Core Ultra 9 285K.
â€¢ It outperforms the AMD Ryzen 9 9950X3D by a small margin in single-core and by over 11% in multi-core performance.
content_en:
Recent Geekbench Browser database entries have revealed test scores and basic specifications for two of Intel's upcoming 'Arrow Lake Refresh' flagships. On January 13th, a not-yet-launched Core Ultra 9 290HX Plus mobile unit was tracked in a new Acer Predator Helios gaming laptop. A few hours earlier, Team Blue's Core Ultra 9 290K Plus desktop chip entered the fray onboard a test rig built around Gigabyte's top-level and world record-holding Z890 AORUS TACHYON ICE mainboard configured with 48 GB DDR5-8000 of system memory. This leak shows the future 24-core 'Arrow Lake Refresh' range topper posting overall scores of 3456 single-core and 24610 multicore points in Geekbench 6.5 test scenarios. News reports have quickly compared the Core Ultra 9 290K Plus to a nearby non-refreshed 'Arrow Lake' partâ€”Core Ultra 9 285K, showing a 7% improvement in single-core and a 9% improvement in multi-core tests. When compared to AMD's fanciest 'Granite Ridge' desktop offeringâ€”Ryzen 9 9950X3Dâ€”the Core Ultra 9 290K Plus is 2% faster in terms of single-core results, and 11% above in multicore. Interestingly, the lesser Core Ultra 9 270K Plus model was Geekbenched in December, producing 3235 (single-core) and 21368 (multicore) tallies. The flagship 'Arrow Lake-S Refresh' SKU is about 7% and 15% faster (respectively).

Review (EN)

Absolutely insane specs! Arrow Lake Refresh has the potential to leave AMD in the dust. The multi-core gains are particularly impressive. Can't wait to see what this means for gaming PCs!

title_en: CPI Unveils VersaEdge: Next-Gen Wall-Mount Data Center Cabinet for Simplified Edge Infrastructure!
summary_en:
â€¢ CPI has announced VersaEdge, a new edge infrastructure product designed for distributed computing environments.
â€¢ The wall-mount design simplifies installation and management, while the modular design allows for flexible scalability.
â€¢ VersaEdge will make its public debut at BICSI Winter 2026, showcasing its advanced thermal performance and rapid deployment capabilities.
content_en:
Chatsworth Products Inc. (CPI), a global leader in power, cooling, and rack infrastructure for IT environments, today announced the launch of the VersaEdge Wall-Mount Cabinet, a next-generation edge infrastructure product designed to dramatically simplify the deployment and management of distributed computing environments. The VersaEdge combines modular scalability, streamlined installation, and robust reliabilityâ€”delivering a turnkey solution that meets the growing performance, density, and flexibility demands of today's edge-driven workloads. According to Michael Moore, Senior Product Manager, Open Architecture Systems at CPI, â€œWith increasing demand for distributed compute and edge deployments, customers need infrastructure that can adapt quicklyâ€”without sacrificing reliability or performance.â€ He further stated, â€œThe VersaEdge Wall-Mount Cabinet represents our commitment to delivering future-ready infrastructure that empowers organizations to deploy edge resources faster, scale with confidence, and optimize cost and efficiency.â€ The product will be publicly unveiled at BICSI Winter 2026.

Review (EN)

This wall-mount data center cabinet is a game-changer! It has the potential to accelerate the adoption of edge computing. Easy installation and high scalability are incredibly attractive, especially in space-constrained environments.

title_en: GeForce NOW Launches Native Linux App & Amazon Fire TV Support! New Games Arrive, Evolving Cloud Gaming!
summary_en:
â€¢ GeForce NOW expands its reach with native app support for Linux and Amazon Fire TV.
â€¢ A wide range of new games, including the highly anticipated 'Star Wars Outlaws', are coming to GeForce NOW.
â€¢ A generous giveaway campaign in collaboration with Thrustmaster is now live!
content_en:
NVIDIA's cloud gaming service, GeForce NOW, announced native app support for Linux and Amazon Fire TV sticks at CES 2026, significantly expanding its device compatibility. The service will also gain access to a number of new titles, including the highly anticipated 'Star Wars Outlaws' and games from Devolver Digital. Furthermore, a collaborative giveaway with Thrustmaster offers the T.Flight Hotas One MSFS Edition and a one-month GeForce NOW Ultimate membership, generating considerable excitement. The evolution of cloud gaming continues at a rapid pace.

title_en: Air France Significantly Expands In-Flight Entertainment with Apple TV, Launches Free Streaming via Wi-Fi!
summary_en:
â€¢ Air France now offers passengers free access to select Apple TV+ shows during long-haul flights.
â€¢ Popular titles like 'Ted Lasso' and 'The Morning Show' will have their first three episodes available.
â€¢ The airline has begun offering one week of free Apple TV+ access via its new high-speed Wi-Fi portal, with fleet-wide rollout expected by year-end.
content_en:
Air France today announced the launch of a new service providing passengers with free access to select Apple TV+ shows during long-haul flights. The available content exceeds 45 hours, including the first three episodes of popular titles such as 'Ted Lasso,' 'The Morning Show,' 'Severance,' 'Prehistoric Planet,' and 'The Snoopy Show.' These shows are accessible on each passenger's individual screen in both French and English. Furthermore, Air France has begun offering one week of free access to Apple TV+ content through its new high-speed Wi-Fi portal, with a planned fleet-wide rollout by the end of the year. Airlines such as American Airlines and United Airlines also offer similar Apple TV streaming services. This expansion of services will undoubtedly enhance the comfort of long-haul flights.

Review (EN)

This is fantastic news! Free Apple TV+ on flights? Sign me up! The Wi-Fi access is a game-changer. Air France is really stepping up their in-flight entertainment.

title_en: Sci-Fi Strategy Game 'Earth Must Die' Announces January 27th, 2026 Steam Release! Demo Available Now!
summary_en:
â€¢ The sci-fi strategy game 'Earth Must Die' is set to release on Steam on January 27th, 2026.
â€¢ Developed by Size Five Games, the game features a humorous world and unique elements like bars for small blue aliens and an 'orgy room'.
â€¢ A demo version of the game is currently available, allowing players to experience the gameplay before release.
content_en:
Size Five Games' sci-fi strategy game, 'Earth Must Die,' has announced its release date. The game is scheduled to launch on Steam on January 27th, 2026. Players will take on the role of alien invaders aiming to conquer Earth. The development team has focused on delivering humor across all languages and has created a detailed world featuring unique elements such as bars for small blue aliens and an 'orgy room'. A demo version of the game is currently available, allowing players to experience the gameplay before the full release. This appears to be a highly unique title, showcasing the developer's passion.

Review (EN)

Seriously impressed by the game's concept and the developer's sense of humor! The 'orgy room' was... unexpected, but maybe it fits the game's world. Check out the demo and enjoy invading Earth!

title_en: BREAKING: NVIDIA Reportedly Cuts GPU Supply to AIC Partners by Up to 20%? Impact of Blackwell Shift Significant?
summary_en:
â€¢ MEGAsizeGPU reports that NVIDIA may reduce GPU shipments to AIC partners by 15-20%.
â€¢ The reason for the supply cut is speculated to be a shift in TSMC production capacity towards server-grade Blackwell chips (B200/B300).
â€¢ Fortunately, NVIDIA continues to bundle GDDR7 memory with cards supplied to AICs, alleviating concerns about memory procurement.
content_en:
According to MEGAsizeGPU, a source with a proven track record of accurately predicting NVIDIA lineups, NVIDIA may reduce GPU shipments to add-in-card (AIC) partners by 15-20%. Typically, GPU manufacturers supply AIC partners with raw GPU dies packaged with GDDR memory as a kit, with AICs responsible for engineering and integration. However, NVIDIA appears to have decided to cut current volumes by up to one-fifth. The reasoning behind this decision and the potential impact on aftermarket pricing remain unknown. It is speculated that NVIDIA is reallocating TSMC capacity from consumer â€œBlackwellâ€ chips to server-grade â€œBlackwellâ€ chips like the B200 and B300. Previously, there were rumors that manufacturers would need to source their own GDDR7 chips from SK Hynix, Samsung, and Micron. However, NVIDIA continues to provide a GPU and memory kit, alleviating those concerns. This is a reassuring development.

Review (EN)

This supply cut could significantly impact the graphics card market. Is server demand for Blackwell unexpectedly high, or is there another reason? Glad to see GDDR7 supply is secure, but price hikes may be inevitable!

title_en: Spotify Raises Subscription Prices in the US Again! Third Revision in Three Years!
summary_en:
â€¢ Spotify has announced a price increase for subscriptions in the US, Estonia, and Latvia.
â€¢ The Individual plan will increase to $12.99/month, the Student plan to $6.99/month, the Duo plan to $18.99/month, and the Family plan to $21.99/month.
â€¢ This is the third price increase in the US since mid-2023, with Spotify citing the delivery of value and benefits to artists as the reason.
content_en:
Spotify today announced a price increase in the United States, Estonia, and Latvia. This marks the company's third US price increase in less than three years. Premium subscribers in the affected markets will receive an email over the coming month explaining how the new pricing will apply to their accounts. The revised prices will take effect on subscribers' next billing date, while new customers will see the updated pricing immediately when signing up on spotify.com/premium. In the United States, Spotify is increasing the cost of every major Premium tier. The Individual Premium plan will rise from $11.99 to $12.99 per month, the Student plan from $5.99 to $6.99 per month. Multi-user plans are seeing larger increases, with the Duo plan, which supports two accounts, moving from $16.99 to $18.99 per month, and the Family plan increasing from $19.99 to $21.99 per month. Spotify attributed the changes to what it described as periodic adjustments across its markets. Spotify stated that these updates reflect the value that Spotify delivers, enabling it to continue offering the best possible experience and benefit artists. This latest increase is the third time Spotify has raised U.S. subscription prices since mid-2023.

Review (EN)

Ouch, that's a tough one. Spotify's great, but 3 price hikes in 3 years is rough, especially for students. Wonder what the competition is doing...

title_en: New Studio Display or Pro Display XDR Spotted in Regulatory Database! Potential for Mini-LED?
summary_en:
â€¢ An unreleased Apple display (model number A3350) has surfaced in a Chinese regulatory database.
â€¢ The model is likely the next-generation Studio Display or Pro Display XDR and will feature a high-performance LCD panel.
â€¢ Similar to the Studio Display's release in 2022, an announcement could occur around March or April.
content_en:
According to a report by MacRumors today, an unreleased Apple display (model number A3350) has surfaced in a Chinese regulatory database. This filing is likely for Apple's next-generation Studio Display or Pro Display XDR, but there is currently not enough information to determine which one it will be. The listing reveals that the new model will be equipped with a high-performance LCD display. As both the existing Studio Display and Pro Display XDR utilize LCD panels, this information is not conclusive. However, it does seemingly rule out an OLED display for this particular model. Rumors about a new Studio Display have been circulating, with speculated features including ProMotion support for up to a 120Hz refresh rate, HDR support, and either an A19 or A19 Pro chip. A new Studio Display with mini-LED backlighting would still utilize an LCD panel, so the filing does not exclude that possibility. The current Studio Display was filed in the same database approximately three months before its launch in March 2022, suggesting a potential release timeframe of March or April this year if this filing pertains to the next Studio Display. It would make sense for Apple to unveil a new Studio Display alongside the next Mac Studio with M5 chips. There have been fewer rumors regarding a new Pro Display XDR, but given that the current model was released in December 2019, an update is certainly due.

Review (EN)

Seriously impressive specs! The potential for mini-LED backlighting will dramatically improve picture quality. Paired with the M5 chip, this could be the ultimate setup for pro creators. Can't wait for the release!

title_en: Major Blow! Camouflaj Exits VR Game Development, Batman: Arkham Shadow Sequel Canceled!
summary_en:
â€¢ Camouflaj has completely ceased VR game development following significant layoffs by Meta.
â€¢ The sequel to the 2024 VR hit, Batman: Arkham Shadow, has been canceled.
â€¢ Meta has also shuttered Twisted Pixel Games and Sanzaru Games, indicating a broader reduction in its VR development efforts.
content_en:
Camouflaj has announced it will no longer be developing VR games after being significantly impacted by Metaâ€™s recent 10% layoffs within its Reality Labs division. The sequel to their critically acclaimed 2024 VR title, Batman: Arkham Shadow, which was accidentally confirmed by voice actor Mark Rolston, has been canceled as a result. Furthermore, Meta has also shuttered Twisted Pixel Games and Sanzaru Games, signaling a shift in strategy regarding VR game development. This represents a significant development within the VR industry.

Review (EN)

Seriously disappointing news! Batman: Arkham Shadow was a VR breakthrough, and I was really looking forward to the sequel. Meta's VR strategy shift could have huge implications for the market.

content_en:
Verizon has announced it will offer a $20 credit to customers affected by Wednesdayâ€™s widespread network outage across the United States. Affected users will receive a text message from Verizon and will then be able to redeem the credit by logging into the myVerizon app. Verizon states it will contact its business customers directly to explain the credit redemption process. While Verizon notes the $20 credit is not intended as full compensation, the swift response and consideration for its users represent a crucial step towards restoring trust.
